section: The term of this Agreement shall continue for one (1) year following the Launch Date, unless earlier terminated as provided herein. This Agreement may be renewed for any number of successive one (1) year terms by mutual written agreement of the parties prior to the conclusion of the term of this Agreement. A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect. A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect. In the event that neither party expresses a desire to renew the agreement in writing, the term of this Agreement shall expire automatically.
explanation: The section contains a duplicated sentence: 'A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect.' This repetition does not inherently create a contradiction but is a structural flaw and suggests a copy-paste error, which undermines the document's credibility and increases the risk of misinterpretation during enforcement.

section: Each party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify the other party (the "Indemnified Party") against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which the Indemnified Party may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from the Indemnifying Party's acts, omissions or misrepresentations to the extent that the Indemnified Party is deemed a principal of the Indemnifying Party. In addition, 2TheMart shall indemnify i-Escrow against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which i-Escrow may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from 2TheMart Content. In addition, i-Escrow shall indemnify 2TheMart against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which 2TheMart may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from i-Escrow Source: 2THEMART COM INC, 10-12G, 8/26/1999 Content and or the Services provided to Customers.
explanation: This section creates an ambiguity due to the poorly structured phrasing. It states that each party will indemnify the other for claims arising from the indemnifying party's actions when the 'Indemnified Party is deemed a principal of the Indemnifying Party.' This clause is unclear. The common understanding of indemnity is to protect against the actions *of* the Indemnifying Party, not when the Indemnified Party is a principal. This is contradictory to the general concept of indemnification, potentially leading to disputes about the scope of indemnity coverage.

section: Notice shall be deemed given: only upon personal delivery; if sent by fax, only if acknowledged by phone; or if sent by a reputable overnight courier with tracking capabilities, only three (3) days after the date of mailing
explanation: The language regarding overnight courier is structurally flawed. It states that notice is deemed given 'only three (3) days after the date of mailing' when sent by overnight courier with tracking. This implies the notice is only effective *after* it is mailed, regardless of when it is received. Standard practice is that a reputable overnight courier delivers the document within 1-2 business days. The structural flaw makes the clause contradictory and ineffective, as it introduces an unnecessary and illogical delay.
